data.question: What is the chemical formula of the microporous material discussed?
What properties does [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O exhibit?
data.answer: Single-chain magnetism and reversible changes in magnetism upon desolvation and resolvation.

data.question: What is the yield percentage of [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O when synthesized?
What is the BET surface area of the desolvated [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]?
What is the hydrogen sorption capacity of the compound at 120 kPa?
What is the role of H2bdt in the synthesis of [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O?
data.answer: It acts as a ligand that tethers and extends to mimic linear dicarboxylates, providing spatial extension in the construction of the framework.

data.question: What happens to the magnetic properties of [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O upon desolvation?
data.answer: The high-spin state of cobalt(II) centers is reduced, indicating antiferromagnetic interactions.

data.question: Why is the compound [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O considered thermally robust?
data.answer: Because its Co bdt framework is persistent to 325 8C and retained upon loss of water of crystallization.

data.question: How does the structure of [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O contribute to its magnetic properties?
data.answer: The linear chain motif and the tilting of the anisotropy axes of neighboring cobalt ions give rise to an uncompensated magnetic moment.

data.question: What is the significance of the hydrothermal reaction conditions in the synthesis of [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O?
data.answer: The hydrothermal approach provides materials that are both hydrolytically and thermally robust.

data.question: What is the role of HF in the synthesis of [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O?
data.answer: HF is used in the hydrothermal reaction, likely aiding in the deprotonation of H2bdt upon coordination to metal ions.

data.question: How does the desolvated [Co2(H0.67bdt)3] exhibit type I isotherms?
data.answer: Due to its microporous character, allowing for significant gas uptake.

data.question: Is [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O hydrolytically stable?
Does [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O lose its crystallinity upon dehydration and rehydration?
Is the magnetic behavior of [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O identical before and after desolvation?
Can the single-chain magnetic properties of [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O be restored after resolvation?
Is the synthesis of [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O carried out at room temperature?
Does [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O exhibit a weight loss of approximately 28% between room temperature and 130 8C due to the loss of water of crystallization?
Is the BET surface area of the desolvated [Co2(H0.67bdt)3] less than 500 m2 g-1?
Does the compound [Co2(H0.67bdt)3]·20 H2O have a three-dimensional structure?
